results.title: Nevil the ninja
results.creator_credit: John Bird, Grant Noble and David Atkinson
results.brief_description: It’s show and tell day at school and a young girl recites a poem in front of the whole class recounting the exploits of Nevil Ninja, master of the ancient and dubious art of Ninjutsu and the story of his defeat against a very little girl.

results.title: Sister Wendy's odyssey. -Volume 1
results.creator_credit: John Hooper, Nicholas Rossiter and BBC
results.brief_description: Sister Wendy Beckett has a passion for art and leaves the confines of her religious silence in search of the art treasures she has found in books and on postcards. For Sister Wendy art represents a window to something greater, and when one is looking at art, one is looking at God. In this first part of the odyssey in which Sister Wendy openly shares her first impressions of seeing the art she’s admired, she visits galleries in Liverpool, Cambridge and Oxford, stopping to reflect on her favourite pieces. PLEASE NOTE: THERE IS A CLOCK TIMER BETWEEN EACH EPISODE ON THE TAPE

results.title: Blue
results.brief_description: Travellers crossing a post-apolcalyptic landscape unearth a time capsule containing the accumulated wealth and knowledge of a now extinct society (ours). They are now faced with a cruel dilemma: should they study this ancient civilization or simply consume its last remaining treasures?

results.title: Sixteen days in September
results.brief_description: The September 2000 Olympic Games held in Sydney, Australia has been hailed as the Games that restored people’s faith in the Olympic movement. With a global participation of 11,000 athletes from 200 nations, this commemorative program captures all the greatest achievements and performances of Australia’s most successful Olympic team ever and shows all of their medal-winning performances, whether Gold, Silver or Bronze.

results.title: Sirius puppy training with Dr. Ian Dunbar
results.creator_credit: Beth M Toth, Martin Bluford and Bluford-Toth Productions
results.brief_description: This video is the first comprehensive obedience, behaviour and temperament training program designed especially for puppies. Emphasising family participation, this video shows owners how to teach their puppy basic obedience commands such as “come”, “sit”, “heel”, and “stay”. Through daily handling and calming exercises, your puppy can also be taught to overcome biting, barking, and housetraining behavioural problems. The aim of the video is to train dogs to be good companions and a joy to live with.

results.title: Sir! Sir!
results.creator_credit: Michael Rubbo, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Here is what happened in a Toronto classroom when teachers occupied the children’s desks and children became the teachers. The film grew out of another, Mrs. Ryan’s Drama Class, where young children found their way into creative drama. There is food for thought in this impromptu reversal of roles.

results.title: Six in Paris = Paris vu par ...
results.creator_credit: Claude Chabrol, Jean-Luc Godard, Eric Rohmer, Jean-Daniel Pollet, Jean Rouch, Jean Douchet, Barbet Schroeder and Les Films du Losange
results.brief_description: Frustrated in their efforts to find financial backing, six French film-makers took to the streets of Paris with scripts of their own devising and 16mm cameras in this demonstration of low budget, rapid production filmmaking. Many of the directors, actors and cinematographers in this compilation would go on to become central figures of the French New Wave. 1.”Saint-Germain-des-Pres” (Jean Douchet) An American studying in Paris is dropped by one French boy only to be picked up by another 2.”Gare du Nord” (Jean Rouch) A young couple’s row is observed in real time in one continuous take 3.”Rue-Saint Denis” (Jean-Daniel Pollet) A shy dishawasher brings a prostitute back to his room 4.”Place de l’Etoile (Eric Rohmer) A businessman hits a tramp with his umberella and imagines he has killed him 5.”Montparnasse et Levallois” (Jean-Luc Godard) A girl fears she has mixed up letters to her two lovers 6.”La Muette” (Claude Chabrol) A young boy tired of hearing his parents argue buys earplugs and fails to hear his mother’s cry for help. In French with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Claude Chabrol, Jean-Luc Godard, Eric Rohmer, Jean-Daniel Pollet, Jean Rouch, Jean Douchet, Barbet Schroeder and Les Films du Losange

results.title: Alex and the beast within
results.creator_credit: David Atkinson, John Bird and Dominic O'Brien
results.brief_description: Cities are a hard place, some say they’re filled with sharks. One man haunted by this belief disappears into his fantasy emerging with the realisation that perhaps there are dragons too.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Atkinson, John Bird and Dominic O’Brien

results.title: Six days seven nights
results.creator_credit: Ivan Reitman, Roger Birnbaum, Wallis Nicita and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: The perfect scenario - a remote island vacation with the man you love. He proposes, you say yes, life is wonderful. Then you are called away to do a one-day shoot in Tahiti and suddenly your life changes. High-powered New York magazine editor Robin Monroe (Anne Heche) finds herself in this very situation when the plane, engaged for the one-day shoot and piloted by the rough and ready Quinn Harris (Harrison Ford), is forced to land in stormy weather on an unknown remote island. Robin and Quinn are left to deal with each other, with survival and an uncertain future, whilst Robin’s boyfriend Frank (David Schwimmer) and Quinn’s girlfriend Angelica (Jacqueline Obradors) share their fears and concern at the hotel bar. Filmed on location on the Hawaiian island of Kauai. Cast also includes Allison Janney, Temuera Morrison.

results.title: Six Chevaux Bleus = Six Blue Horses
results.brief_description:
A Chinese man inherit six blue porcelain horses and discovers that one of them contains the combination to a safe filled with diamonds. In order to recover the diamonds which are guarded by an antiquarian, the old man’s nephews must contend with a gang of criminals.

Credits: Producer, Michel Peynet ; director, Philippe Joulia ; writers, Philippe Joulia, Yves Desmoulin ; photography, Jacques Ledoux ; music, Antoine Duhamel.
Cast: Henri Cremieux, Yvonne Clech, Corinne Le Poulain, Patrick Boitet, Pascal Boitet.
